page.title: 03THE MARKET SQUARE
page.content: The{Market Square}has changed very little in the past two hundred years. Some of the buildings are now shops. There is also an {old peoples home } opposite the Market Square.A{brewery} once stood where Pattisons the Newsagents is today.On the South side of the Square there is an 18 century house which is now the modern Dental Practice of Mr David Watt. In the Square on a Monday people come with their{stalls}to sell things like clothes, and shoes, others sell food.The Chamber of Trade erect an illuminated Christmas tree in the Square. Through the{Cloisters}into the Churchyard there is a large flat stone where tenants placed their rent money instead of tithes.This was until 1836 when the custom died.
